Description: Vintage Kramer Focus Guitar! Extremely yellowed "white" paint … Needs strings and some tender loving care! Case handle is broke but come with new handle (needs to be installed) … Please see pics! Thanks for Looking! On Feb-03-19 at 04:59:09 PST, seller added the following information: In response to the numerous questions I've received … This was my first guitar, and was purchased somewhere right around 1987 from Strings & Things in Memphis, TN … I played it for a few years then gave it to my brother. He played it most of the early 90's, then it pretty much just hung in a smoke-filled studio for around 12 or so years … then into the case and the attic until recently discovered during a clean out last year. Debated on keeping it for sentimental value, but I only play bass now, and wouldn't really do anything with this … and from my research, these are still fairly popular! So, I've decided to let it go … There has never been any major damage or repairs to the guitar … no breaks, cracks. etc. It is all original including the case. The neck is straight with no bows or imperfections and the frets are in pretty good shape for it's age! Obviously the Floyd needs some attention (and that is one of the original Floyd Rose tremolos!) … The strap buttons are missing and not included, as well as the spring cover on the back. My brother had eye hooks for the strap like Eddie Van Halen had on Frankenstein & his Kramer guitars during the time he endorsed them … The eye hooks are not on the guitar any more either … The headstock … It was originally white with the Kramer Focus logo. It was sanded (stripped?) I believe by Strings & Things as well … It was painted with gloss black with a light coat of clear lacquer … How it got to how it looks now is anybody's guess! The guitar weighs 7.15 lbs on my digital scale … so, just shy of 8 lbs! Thanks for all the questions and the interest!
Title: VINTAGE KRAMER FOCUS GUITAR
